reviews.author: YDH
reviews.title: Promotion and Ad Mgmt
reviews.comment_content:
This course mainly introduces the IMC in Promotion. (i.e. focus on one of the 4Ps in Marketing). Before getting into the discussion on IMC, it spends pretty much time on something basic, like 3Cs and STP covered in MARK2120.

1. Intro of IMC
2. 3Cs, STP
3.Communication Theory and Consumer Behaviour (Background: MARK3420 CB)
4.Setting Objectives in Promotion and Ad
5. Creativity
6. Sales Promotion (Coupon, event marketing...)
7. Media Strategy
8. Effectiveness
9. Word-of-Month

You can see most of the materials are covered in MARK2120 or MARK3420. If you really want to learn something new, do not choose this course. But that's a good course if you wanna "hea"
reviews.comment_teaching:
Nice Korean Women, quite pretty.
Powerpoint slides are in good organisation.
Powerpoint-reader, a bit boring in class.
Need to jot some notes on some examples covered in class, will be tested in the quizzes.
reviews.comment_grading:
1) Quizzes                               25% each
2) Group Project Report           25%
3) Group Project Presentation     10%
4) Group Persuasion Skits           5%
5) In-Class Group Exercise         8%
6) Research Credit                        2%
7) Class Participation               +/- 5%

It is really hard to beat the curve.
i got 86% = B
Mean of A range = 90%

(Note: The stat is from Prof, as I wrote to her after the grade released, she told me she has been graceful to give out grade , as being lenient than the policy and told me my initial grade is B-)

I let you guys to think whether this is good grade or not.
reviews.comment_workload:
Project (Final Report and Presentation): Only final report and presentation count towards the final grade, progress reports can "hea" do.

Some in-class exercises serve as attendance checking.

Two HBS Cases to read, no work to do on that, just listen to her bullshit in lecture.

A little drama to introduce some principles in "Psychology of Persuasion"

Quizzes consist of MC, fill in the blanks and SQ (Memorisations, no application is needed.) Best 2 of 3 count toward the grade.

reviews.author: mushroom
reviews.comment_content: Content is easy but not boring since the professor has a lot of examples (stories, videos, ads). Having taken MARK3420 helps because the 4th chapter is the summary of consumer behavior.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Joseph SALVACRUZ is good. I recommend to take his MARK3420, too. He also invited a guest speaker for us to let us know more about the real case. There will be case discussions, too.
reviews.comment_grading: The mean of the two midterms are high. So I think the grading depends a lot on the group project. He will print out the project and grade it carefully. So you definitely want to score high on the project.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is okay and I think low for a 4 credit course. The first half of the semester is easy, but you should start the project ASAP after midterm one. The project will require creativity and a lot of searching. Since the professor will assign groups for you, communication between members is very important. Our group uses up a huge amount of time to discuss.

reviews.author: garypeach
reviews.title: Old professor teaching...Granny Style and boring
reviews.comment_content: Content covers a lot useful and related concepts of Marketing, especially Integrated Marketing Communication. From exposure to after sales feelings. Quite interesting content, just wonder how the prof. could make the whole course become boring... Also he will waste a lot of time to talk __, so we could not cover all topics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ex-termly boring teaching style. From tone,to power-point, teaching materials, activities.... This semester used online teaching, easier for us to take rest from boredom of the lesson.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading should be fine.
If u are willing to pay attention to lesson, you can get a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload: workload actually quite heavy if you want to be a good student. not recommend to people who want to learn with fun.

reviews.author: Lily:)
reviews.title: The professor is nice!
reviews.comment_content: The content of the courses is quite heavy since you need to study the textbook also to get a good grade on the quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style is nice and comfortable, there will be a lot of cases to help you understand the content.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is ok, you can get a B or B+ if you overall above one sd for the quizzes.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is fine, there are only one project and three quizzes, but there are also in class exercises so you cannot skip the classes.

reviews.comment_content:
If you study MARK at 2000 level the content should be easy to follow as it covers STP and talks about 4Ps - Promotion

Lots of interesting examples and ad, just memorise all for your exam then you should do fine
reviews.comment_teaching: The pace is easy to follow and not too wordy slides. Will distribute in class group exercise as attendance. You don't need to answer question for participation points, you just need to submit the group exercise
reviews.comment_grading:
For all my test I am above mean or mean (80%+) and our group project professor say it is an A+ project but at the end our group only get B+ or around B range. As professor replied to us saying those who got A range their test is around 90+%.

Which is quite bad as project worths 40% and at the end we only get B
reviews.comment_workload: Similar to other marketing course you have one group project and present to the class at the end of the semester. You have to submit different parts of the project in different dates. So if you submit everything on time then you won't have to rush through everything at the end.

reviews.author: unspecified
reviews.comment_content: Content goes through the entire marketing mix (from 4Ps to 3Cs to finally IMC). Although it does talk about IMC, around half the syllabus is from MARK 2120 and 3420.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Huh is super nice in terms of after-class discussions. She actively wants students to participate heavily in class, so try and speak up as much as you can. Her teaching is pretty good, although mostly from notes she adds extra content that is usually tested, so pay attention in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Above mean by 1 SD for both quizzes, nearly perfect score in final report and presentation. Finally got an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say the workload is pretty good compared to other courses. Although the final exam and report are quite difficult (30 pages report), there are only 3 quizzes, with no final exam.
